title: For Sale:  I just wanted to rant a little!
postcontent:
I contacted a guy on ARMSLIST (Kurt Kristensen) about one of his rifles he had for sale. First off, his ad was for Eugen, but he live in Readsport.
   Kurt quoted me a price that I found to be fair. He told me he wanted to do a bill of sale & wanted a copy of my D.L.! I said no problem. We talked two days before our meet, he tells me he wants the cash in all Twenty Dollar bills. I say OK, as I'm thinking to my self "this guy seems a bit anal". Today, Kurt calls me 25 hours before our meet. He tells me he "misquoted me"! He says he did some research & the rifle is worth more than twice the price we agreed on (It is not worth that much). Then he tells me he will "MAKE IT RIGHT WITH ME", & gives me a new price, 40% higher than the original price!!!! I told him the gun is not worth what he thinks it is. I then proceeded to tell him the new quote he gave me was at the high end of the guns value. I may have agreed to purchase the rifle at that price from the beginning, but not now! 

I'm not telling anyone NOT to deal with this guy, I'm just letting you all know what I had to deal with!    
Here is the link to his ad:  http://www.armslist.com/posts/1408820/eugene-oregon-rifles-for-sale--wwii-bolt-action-rifle-collection

title: Want To Buy:  Older German Sporting Guns
postcontent:
Collector interested in buying/trading for higher quality pre-WWII German sporting/hunting rifles, bolt-action, single shot, multibarrel.  Not interested in military rifles or rusty hulks or too much in shotguns.  A piece that will interest me likely came to Oklahoma in a duffle bag as a WWII souvenir and has a look just a bit different than most American arms.  It may not have ever been shot in America because nobody could ever figure out what ammo fit and where to get it.  Chances are, nobody has been able to find any info on the maker or identify the piece in a price guide.  Metal work may be engraved; the stock may be ornamentally carved, and the piece will be in pretty good shape.  I might have interest in a similar piece made between 1900 and 1940 or so in another European country.  

If the above describes a firearm gathering dust in your closet that you would like to sell or trade for a more useful modern American rifle, e-mail me a description of what you have, pictures if you have them, and a phone number and time for me to call you to discuss.  If you have an idea of what you want for the piece, that is good to know.  If nothing else, I may be able to tell you something about the gun that you did not know.  I am retired and willing to travel 100 miles or so from Tulsa to look at something that sounds interesting and can usually set an appointment to meet within a week.   

Face to face transactions in compliance with the law only.  Please understand that I will need a bill of sale and to see ID confirming seller identity for anything I buy and will take steps to insure I am not buying stolen goods.

title: For Sale:  Flying Tigers AVG Flight Jacket
postcontent:
Offered for sale is a very unique reproduction A-2 flight jacket made in the 1980s by Protech Leather Co.  Made in the USA.  

The jacket was produced in the late 1980s as an exact replica of a U.S. Army Air Force issue flight jacket by USAAF specs.   All patches are hand crafted and painted by hand by a professional here in the U.S. not silk screen or any other mass produced method. 

The patches were all added back in the 1980s.  The AVG Flying Tiger patches on the shoulder and chest were hand painted on leather in the 1980s by a famous WW2 patch maker.  They are suppose to be faithful to the original design.   

The blood chit on the back is a bit of a mystery.  It was purchased from a military surplus store in the mid 1980s and may possibly be original to WW2.  Its painted on genuine leather as well.  But I can’t confirm if this part of the jacket is in fact original or not, so I’ll selling everything as a very high quality reproduction.  

I purchased this jacket new and wore it only occasionally when I first got it and almost never the last 20 years.  It’s been well protected in my closet and has seen no rain or weather.   Size 42.

I've been asked about the patch that was removed from the front of the jacket and appears to be missing.   That was an unrelated WW2 patch that was originally sewn on when I first got the jacket and was removed when the Flying Tiger patches were added since it would not have been historically accurate. 

I've come down substantially on the price and it pains me to have to sell it this low.   If you're interested, please buy it before I change my mind and just keep it in my collection. 

$300 or best offer.   I will ship anywhere in the USA priority mail at no extra charge.

The wood is in decent shape, there is a crack near the receiver, but it doesn't appear to be deep, and had not effected the guns function. It has been in a sock in my safe for a while now and I'd rather make some room. 


I'm looking for an SP101 3" or a J-Frame (any barrel length) will trade the 1897 plus cash for either. 
These guns were produced in high numbers, but you don't see the over 100 year old models as much lately. Would be great for cowboy action shooting or just as a conversation piece.

postcontent:
I have up for sale a brand new Protech Armoured Products Delta 4 Police/ Military Helmet.
 I don't have a box for it not sure it even came in one however have the duster bag it comes with. It is a size Large: 7 3/8" - 7 3/4" / Shell Size Large / Padding .75" This is level III-A body armour. See chart below for details.

I bought many items from a security firm and will be listing them. This is a honey and very very hard to get hold of. Mostly sold only to police and military but not illegal to own. 
The full retail on these is $495 (search the web you won't find new one listed for less then $400). I am asking $325 cash money $350 paypal. I would consider a trade but trade value would have to be no less then $450 value. Open to offers of guns, toys and services just make it reasonable but cash is always king and I got it priced to sell so please no low ball offers. 
Below is all the techincal jargon for the helmet I took from their web site. 

The Delta 4 Tactical Helmet by Protech combines an ergonomically contoured style with an upgraded four-point adjustable suspension system, shock-absorbing foam padding and a floating mesh crown for maximum air circulation.

The Delta 4 Tactical Helmet is made with multiple layers of high-performing, lightweight, high-tenacity ballistic aramid composites which allows the helmet to meet and exceeds NIJ 0106.01 standards defeating Level IIIA rounds and velocities.

Delta 4 Tactical Helmet by Protech Features:
• Quick-release buckle
• Adjustable moisture-wicking nape pad
• Includes black drawstring duster bag

Level IIIA:
This is usually the highest threat level in soft body armour. It is usually worn as overt style armour because of the weight and thickness of the ballistic panels. However, with the decrease in weight of newer fabrics, it has become viable for covert use. 

Test Calibres: 9mm 124gr full metal jacket (FMJ) travelling between a speed of 1400fps and 1450fps which is sub machine gun velocity 
  44 magnum 240gr lead semi wad cutter travelling between a speed of 1400fps and 1450fps

The Akdal MKA-1919 is semi-automatic, magazine fed, 12 gauge shotgun made in turkey by Ucyildiz Arms. Resembling an oversize AR-15 the MKA 1919 utilizes the M16 style safety selector, bolt release, magazine release and has a removable carry handle rear sight, making it the perfect companion shotgun for 3 gun, home defense and even hunting. The self regulating nature of the gas system enables the MKA 1919 lightweight shotgun to effortlessly run 2 3/4 and 3 inch shotshells, while not punishing the shooter with excessive recoil. The interchange choke tubes allow for versatility both in the target bay, in the field and in the home. 

Three internal chokes, Full, Modified and Cylinder Bore. Chrome lined barrel. Gas operated-piston driven below the barrel. Self adjusting gas system. Carrying handle sight is removable with a Picatinny rail on upper receiver ready for your optics. Front sight is also removable to facilitate optics on the rail. A svelte 6.5 pounds empty. Last round bolt hold open feature with AR15 bolt release. Manual safety selector lever.

title: For Sale:  New Canik TP-9 9mm Pistol 2 18-round mags holster Like SW99 P99
postcontent:
An awesome pistol for a dirt cheap price for what you get. The Canik TP-9 is a clone of the Walther P99 and Smith & Wesson SW99 but improved. It is a striker fired double / single action pistol with a ambi decocker. The gun can be fired in double action mode for the first shot for a long, smooth, and safe trigger pull. Or when cocked back trigger can be lightly pulled for a light single action first shot. Great for IDPA shoots or competetions. Red striker sticks out the back of the slide when cocked so you know exactly what mode the gun is in. Comes with hard case, 2 18-round magazines, speed loader, lock, cleaning kit, and retention style holster. Holster comes with paddle back for tucking inside the pants or a belt loop mount and is easily changed back and forth. Magazine release is on the grip (not on trigger guard like the Walther or S&W) An excellent weapon built on a tested platform. $364.88 plus tax. Call or text REDACTED. 
Headshot Tactical Customs

title: For Sale:  Springfield XDM .45 4.5" + Polished Barrel + More!
postcontent:
This .45 acp XDm is in amazing condition with a very low round count. I recently put a good bit of time into polishing the barrel and the guide rod. Gives the gun a very sharp/clean/intimidating look. I did NOT do mirror finish because I think the brushed aluminum look is very sharp and a bit easier to keep looking clean. The feed ramp has been well polished to a mirror like finish and ammo slides into position VERY easily. Ejects ammo beautifully as well. Has been well cleaned (ask me for pictures of my other weapons and you will see the OCD I have. I am also INCLUDING x2 magazines of ammo which is 26 rounds. This is 230 grain 45 FMJ ammo. I have not experienced any jams, FTFs, FTEs, or any other complications while shooting this gun. Shoots very well and the trigger pull seems even lighter than the 5.5lbs it claims. 

The XDm features: grip safety (1911 style; I prefer this to the Glock angled grip), loaded chamber indicator, striker status indicator (This feature is NOT on a Glock), MATCH GRADE barrel, Major Grasp serrations (front and back of slide), minimal reset trigger (one of the smoothest I’ve felt on a 45) and fixed dovetail white 3-dot sights. 

Pistol package includes: (2) 13-round magazines, 26 rounds of 230 grain 45 ammo, molded holster and mag pouch, mag loading tool, cable lock, heavy-duty plastic case, and owner's manual.

Pricing: This package sells for right around 689.99. Fairly hard to find in the 4.5". The polishing of the barrel and guide rod is a bit expensive addition @ $50+ from someone and the extra 26 rounds (approx. $10) make this deal very fair.

title: For Sale:  Bolt action youth rifle - 4x32 scope, accessories & ammo included!
postcontent:
I have for sale a Crickett- single load, bolt action rifle. This rifle, pink in color, is a kids model with a 4x32mm scope attached. For being what it is (a simple rifle to learn on) my daughter and I have had a lot of fun with it. It has worked exceptionally well while shooting at the range since day one. I am listing this rifle at this time as my daughter has moved on to a repeater.

This rifle did an excellent job at teaching my youngster the basics of firearm safety, handling, shooting, sight picture, breathing technique, stabilization and basic marksmanship. It would make an excellent starter rifle for any youngster looking to learn the art, science and pure fun that a day of shooting can provide. The multi step process of a single load, bolt action rifle helps to teach new shooters how their rifle works as well as enhancing the safety of follow up shots.

At this time, the rifle is, clean, in excellent condition and ready to go. Price is pretty firm as I do not have to sell it but wouldn't mind letting it go to a good home.

Accessories included:
-Scope Mounting base
-Scope Rings
-4x32mm Scope
-Swivel strap hardware & mounting stud
-Elastic adjustable strap
-Bipod with hardware
-NCSTAR 2 rifle, heavy padded, zippered soft case with 5 ext. pockets
-1 Box (50 rounds) of ammo to get you started

At a gun shop you wont get out the door with this rifle fully setup, scope installed, sighted in, in a case, ready to go with ammo in hand for less than $300 after the taxes/fees. Spend less and get more for your money by buying lightly used!

This rifle is Like new with low rounds through it in perfect shape, that being said, make me a reasonable offer, please save your time and mine by not low balling, I'm not in a hurry, but would like to see it go to a good home.

I have a few other things up at this point, be sure to check out my other listings!

title: For Sale:  750rd Case - 5.56 NATO / 223 - M855 / SS109 - 62 Grain FMJ Penetrator Tip Ammo
location: North Fort Wayne, Fort Wayne, Indiana
postcontent:
This 5.56x45mm SS109/M855 ammunition is used by NATO forces throughout the world and considered to be among the best quality ammunition available. Manufactured to strict NATO military specifications for the DAMC (Danish Army Material Command), this ammunition carries the AMA headstamp with the NATO cross. The SS109 projectile features a 62 grain full metal jacket around a lead core with a steel penetrator tip. This standard NATO SS109 bullet is the same as the popular U.S. made M855, only no green paint is applied to the tip. The ammunition is first quality, new production ammunition, loaded in boxer primed, re-loadable brass cases with Mil-Spec crimped sealed primers and sealed bullets. A 750rd case contains 15 sealed 50rd boxes, each containing 5 stripper clips of 10rds sealed in plastic for long term storage.

postcontent: DWM 1915 Luger, Matching, WWI 9mm. Serial # 88xxc. This is a pretty sharp DWM 1915 WWI 9mm Military Luger. All numbered parts except the grips and magazine are matching, and the mag is a correct wood-bottomed WWI. About 85-90% of the original straw remains, and the blued finish has normal holster wear on the barrel and sideplate, and there is very minor freckling on the sideplate and here and there on the receiver, but overall finish condition is about 90%. This is a very collectible WWI Luger that will really enhance a good collection. i do not have a holster or any accessories for this gun. title: For Sale:  Palmetto State Armory AR 15 with Troy Rail, Chrome Bolt, magpul foregrip and laser sight
postcontent:
Selling my Palmetto State Armory AR 15 that has some nice upgrades. I only made it to the range once with this beauty and I put about 150 flawless rounds through it. It is super accurate and a blast to shoot, trigger breaks very nicely. I shot it months ago with plans to go shoot it some more but I just don't make it out enough to have this sitting in the safe so it deserves a better home.

 The gun is all Palmetto State Armory and was purchased as a complete rifle with the following upgrades:

 Chrome Bolt Carrier, Troy Defense Battle Quad Rail (very nice and lightweight), Magpul flip up rear sight, C Products 30 round magazine and a Bulldog Case.

 It has a 1/7 twist 16" chrome lined barrel with flash hider and it is chambered in 5.56x45mm, it is a carbine with a mid length quad rail on it with plenty of room for anything you would want to mount on it, plus a complete set of snap on rail covers in case you want to hold the rifle by the quad rail. It Has a 6 position adjustable stock.

 ALSO INCLUDED BUT IS A MAGPUL FOREGRIP WITH A LASER SIGHT MOUNTED TO THE SIDE OF THE RAIL, THE BUTTON FOR THE LASER IS ON THE FOREGRIP AND IT MAKES FOR A NICE TACTICAL TOOL OR EASY ACQUISITION ON A TARGET.

 The shine you see is a coat of oil I wiped it down with after I cleaned it the last time I shot it, I always put a light coat on my guns before I put them in the safe, the camera flash makes it look a lot shinier than it really is.

 This is a great rifle and I am going to regret selling it one day. I am not looking for any trades but if you have to have the rifle and are offering something nice and attractive I will at least hear your pitch.
